name: Lighthouse Inn at Aransas Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personnel were lovely and very attentive, rooms were great (overlooked the pool) and appointed nicely but the bed was a little hard but passable. Pool/hot tub were great and the "gym" really just a couple of treadmills were very nice in that they looked out over the water. Breakfast was terrific...don't get many places now who serve full breakfast for free...and you got to watch the shrimp boats come in while you ate. Unlike other reviewers we did NOT love the Italian restaurant down the street. Quite a pretty setting - quiet and cozy.
reviews.title: Wonderful - great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice cozy family run place. Highlight of our stay was seeing two dolphins from the dock attached to the back of the hotel. You could probably see them from your balcony if you get a seaward facing room. Nice cozy library at front corner of lobby was a nice place for quiet reading. Great family place-walk to several local seafood places. Near Whooping Crane tours, Aransas NWR and Goose Island State park. Stayed with wife and 2 kids.
reviews.title: Great, Cozy, Saw Dolphins from the Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the ocean-facing rooms were booked but our room looked down on small garden so--not bad at all--but assuming we go to rockport again we'll book earlier for an ocean-facing room.
reviews.title: CHARMING, full of CHARACTER, beds not so much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only downside, my son found some flip-flops and a soda can under the bed from previous guest-so maybe the maids aren't getting into all the corners. Room was clean other than this.
reviews.title: CHILL OUT HERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, and although I would consider staying here again, it probably wouldn't be my first choice. My main selling point on any hotel stay is the comfort of the beds. My suggestion would be an upgrade in mattresses. The beds are the "not so much" in my title statement. Also, don't expect to stay in and eat. The dinner they serve in their bar area is not worth eating. Although, the drinks at the bar were pretty good. Also, their complimentary breakfast was decent. Overall, the stay was enjoyable....the lack of comfortable beds will negate my next visit.
reviews.title: You will love this place & wish you had booked more days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reviewing the other comments we decided to stay at the Lighthouse because it seemed to be the newest and cleanest place in Rockport. Unfortunately it wasn't the case. We changed rooms twice and in both rooms the drapes, upholstery and walls were worn and dirty, althought the hallways on all floors had been newly painted. Body hair from, I assume, the people in the room before us had not been removed from the bathroom floor, toilet and tub. For THREE DAYS. I didn't point it out to the maid because I wanted to see how long it would take them to clean correctly - they managed to out-wait me!
reviews.title: Not a great experience
Nice spot for birding and relaxation
reviews.text: Our room faced the pool, and the piped-in music played throughout the whole night every night...to me, hearing music means "wake up!', so I had a hard time falling and staying asleep because the only time we couldn't hear the music was when the REALLY LOUD air-conditioner kicked on. The walls are also paper-thin and their is a gap about 1" high underneath the room doors into the hallway so there is constant noise from other rooms or hallway activity. We would hear the person's TV from three doors down coming into our room from under the door! Also, the doors are very heavy and close with a loud BOOM every time, so it's just constant noise.

reviews.title: Really Pleased
reviews.text: Next time I'll look into staying at a new Hampton Inn or the Hoops House B&B - it's supposed to be very nice.

reviews.title: A great hotel in a beautiful friendly town
reviews.text: The restaurant is defunct although they still serve breakfast (which was good only for being able to say it was "free".) Oveall it just felt "dirty" in almost every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by many of the attributes of the Lighthouse Inn. We had a bayside suite with kitchenette and planned to do some of our own breakfast cooking (not realizing they provided breakfast.) What a pleasant surprise to have that provided! The early serving times (@ 6:30 a.m. start) were great for us, as we wanted early starts for the spectacular birding sites in the area. (One suggestion is to make this great perk more apparent on the Lighthouse Web and promo items.)
reviews.title: Best stay ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: First let me say that this is a belated review, as I stayed here almost 2 years ago. But better late than never!
reviews.title: Great location and good service
Rockport 2009
reviews.text: I stayed here with my mom and sister, travelling from the UK on a tour of Texas. From the enthusiastic reaction we received, I guess they don't get too many British visitors!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was OK, though we were not offered any help with unloading our bags and taking them to the room.
reviews.title: Perfect start to a Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was quite small, and the pull out bed not very comfortable, but certainly nothing to complain about. Our balcony overlooked the gardens and pier, and we could enjoy lovely views at all times of the day. There was a small kitchen area which was handy for lunch and snacks.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel pool was large and clean, and there were also plenty of seating areas at the back of the hotel by the sea.
reviews.title: FIX the HotTub and Internet
Lighthouse is in the dark about hospitality.
reviews.text: The front desk staff were indifferent at best, pool was closed our entire visit for repairs, breakfast was oddly different everyday and served on the cheapest of paper plates, rooms were small and stuffed with bulky over-the-top furniture. The water tasted truly awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trash strewn parking lot met you on your return each day. Individual staff members were friendly but uncharacteristic of the general grumpy mood of the place.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!
Lighthouse Inn-three thumbs up!
reviews.text: Overall, Rockport was a touristy nightmare. Don't go for the scenery because there isn't any.

reviews.title: We highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway!
reviews.text: We traveled to Rockport for a couple days and ended up staying all week..We loved this hotel so much...It was comfortable with lovely views. We would definately stay there again...Very nice place!!!

reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
reviews.text: We stayed at this wonderful establishment for a week in the middle of July. The room was reasonably large and clean and the view was terrific. The kids had fun splashing in the big pool (which we never found to be crowded) and night fishing off the lighted pier. The included morning breakfast buffet was TERRIFFIC. Noise was never a problem and the staff, while not always the most friendly, did accomodate our few requests. We had a very nice, relaxing time here and would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: The Perfect Coastline of Texas
reviews.text: We just returned yesterday, and we had a wonderful time. The moment we drove into Rockport, I could tell tell it was a very small yet "big at heart" kind of town. It was the perfect setting for our anniversary. We of course stayed at the Lighthouse Inn and it was everything that was to be expected. Right down to the soft bath robes! We had a suite with a kitchen, and for the money it was perfect. Since I am a chef (by profession) I was ready to cook the fresh catch my husband was going to bring in. Sad to report he only caught trout (good but I prefer red or flounders), which of the 50 or so he caught only 5 were keepers. With the guidence of the Fron Desk Clerk Dan (late night clerk) he had wonderful recomendations, and just for that we are deffinately comming back with our waders. Since it is Flounder Season the bays were perfect for floundering. Although this was our first time here, we will be prepaired the next time around. I have been to Corpus Christi, Port Aransas, and other sourrounding areas, and this has to be the best out of all of them. Rockport is said to be the cleanest coastal beach in Texas, and I believe it! Corpus, and Port Aransas is nothing (take my word!) compared to Rockport. The water was really clear to say the least, and pretty, I couldn't believe that we were in Texas! Back to the Hotel, I will try to post my pics.....so you can see that all the pictures that you have seen from other online websites are true to the "T"!!!!! It is very nice, the staff as another "reviewer" posted (rude), they are okay! Just let them know that they are being rude, and BOY THEY WILL DO A 360 on you! I do that with anyone that is rude to me..........I HATE RUDE PEOPLE TOO! Anyways, the rooms are small even the suites but it was just right. The lighted pier was beautiful, and adds a nice "evening fishing touch". My poor husband was so determined to catch "A BIG ONE" that it never came. Maybe next time!!! Please if you get a suite, get one over looking the BAY it is worth it, anything on the opposite side overlooks the pool or the parking lot, NOT GOOD IF YOU ARE SHELLING OUT THE DOUGH! They really do have Starbucks coffee and cups in the room, the pots and pans are decent, but if you plan to cook be sure to bring your own knifes and cooking utensils. It makes cooking more enjoyable, also maybe a bigger chopping board. The refridgerator is full size, and nice, they have an ice machine on the 2nd floor (nice!!!) as we like our drinks COLD!! The porch is very cute, they have two rocking chairs and a table for your morning coffee, or current magazine or book. There are two t.v's one in the master bedroom, and one with a D.V.D player and stereo in the living room, there is also a sofa bed in the living room. Nice for when you are watching a D.V.D. Since we travel a lot we carry DVDs all the time since we have t.v.s in our suburban. The stove is electric (I have yet to find a hotel w/ kitchens that have gas). The table is small but "DO-able". But overall the views from the 2nd floor are beautiful to say the least! We didn't have time to go to the bar downstairs, but there is one! The furniture is nice, as with everything that was in that hotel! I hope this helps you on your search for a hotel in the Rockport area. I've seen majority of the hotels there as we drove Fulton Beach Rd along the coast, and this hotel is the best one BY FAR!!!!! Oh yeah, if you want to eat somewhere nice in the area (me...I prefer cooking since I am a chef, and I Like to save money :)!!! I would highly recomend a nice little joint called the Java Bay Cafe for breakfast(nice breakfast buffet on the weekends) also I love Pinini's and for lunch they make good ones. The boiling pot is right across from the hotel, and it seems if they can sell a bucket of 6 beers for 20 bucks they are trying to reel you in, so be leery! We did eat at Alice Fays, and we didn't like it at all RUDE RUDE RUDE people, and very unfriendly, they quoted us one price and charged us another, and it was horrible!!! DO NOT GO TO ALICE FAYS! There is a brand new super walmart on 35 and it was perfect for getting those last minute things that you forgot! Have Fun and we are already planning our next trip! Maybe we will see you there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for a 2 night business meeting. I had never been to Rockport. The town itself is very small and feels remote, so I was suprised that the hotel was as nice as it was. It appears to be fairly new.
reviews.title: Nice rooms
Our Favorite Hotel
reviews.text: Ask for a room facing the bay. I stayed on the first floor and my room looked right out at the water. I had a small deck w/ 2 rocking chairs and a table. This set up though does not make for much privacy. When I was relaxing in my room I could hear people right outside my room walking around. The second floor might be better. Also, my room was a handicapped room so the shower was very large, but no tub. The rooms come w/ Starbucks coffee and a coffee maker. The bedding was very nice and seemed clean.

reviews.title: Great facility, terrible service
reviews.text: One big complaint about the rooms was the noise at night. There is a wood floor entry way into the rooms so you can hear people stomping around at all hours. Also the doors are heavy and I could hear them slamming a lot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tricky one this.
reviews.title: Curious place - old fashioned, charming but rather jaded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at The Lighthouse Inn, a fine looking period building perched right on the water's edge.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay - Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our balcony room looked over the coast - great for the morning sun but if you're a late starter then take a room facing the pool.
reviews.title: Good to Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Plenty of space - adjoining sitting room and kitchen space with proper cooker, fridge, dishwasher (all rather useful for storing food and brewing up cups of "hot tea"). The room, and indeed hotel's, style is rather like that of an old aunt's house. Dated, floral but not too painful.
reviews.title: Friendly service in a hotel with a touch of class...
Great location, old world comfort, friendly service
reviews.text: Lovely jetty with rocking chairs. Civilised pool area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: For 20 years, I have spent between 75 and 100 nights on the road for both business and pleasure. I have never been treated so badly. We first saw the hotel on a television show that raved about the fine dining, the magnificent hot tub, etc. etc. and immediately made a reservation. Upon arrival a month later, we found out that the restaurant had closed two weeks prior and that only snacks like nachos and sandwiches were available from the bar. The front desk clerk told me they had to close the restaurant because they could not find employees that could pass a drug test. I asked for a refund but was told there was no way that was going to happen. Rather than walk out and ruin my daughters spring break, I decided to tough it out and hope that things improved.
reviews.title: Never Never Never Again
Really a treat on the water
reviews.text: Later that night, we decide to visit the hot tub. Broken. I asked the front desk. Might be fixed tomorrow they said. It was, but broke again that night. Fixed on the third day finally but hot it was not. Warm tub? Sorta. Hot Tub? No.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Also during my stay, I had to bring in my own luggage on a cart that the hotel provided. I have no problem toting my own bags, but the carts tires were flat. I asked three times in four days for them to fix it so that I would not have so much trouble when I checked out. The front desk clerk (same one) told me "they don't look flat to me!" And let it go at that. Repeated requests to the housekeeping and maintenance staff met with similar results.
reviews.title: Disappointing
A great place to visit!
reviews.text: I will say that my room was very nice except for the fact that the seagull droppings never get cleaned off the balconies unless it rains.

reviews.title: Paradise!
reviews.text: Really a relaxing hotel. Lots of quiet places to relax. On the water. And - next to Cheryl's on the Bay - the next best restaurant (after Hemingways) in the area. Cheryl's is not your common restaurant - what tastes, what a menu, what a delight to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very hot at the time of our visits. Dolphins swam right outside of the hotel around the fabulous pier. No beaches in walking distance (but within a couple of miles), but lots of piers to walk and sit upon. We were very pleased with our accomodations at a very reasonable price. Breakfast included was great. The facility had an air of old elegance. The pool was great. A few of the current days leaves in it but unavoidable with all the wind we were having. Accomodations were clean. Mixed real estate in the area ranging from very nice to a substandard, but the hotel itself was wonderful and in a very safe area right on the ocean.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was a little pricey compared to other accomodations in Rockport, the room was neat and clean, although it could have used a little sprucing up. The bathtub had a chip, and some of the drawers were missing drawer pulls. But the A/C worked great and after a day in the sweltering an humid Rockport heat, it was very refreshing to hit the cold room and take a hot shower and relax.
reviews.title: Very nice, very clean, great breakfast buffet, and accomodationg hosts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room had a sitting room with kitchenette (which we didn't use), and another cable TV in the sitting room. There was a small porch where you could sit, have coffee in the provided robes, and look at the sea view.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very nice with fresh scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, muffins, cereal, and some great OJ! There were two machines to make waffles, and they were kept busy.
reviews.title: Lot's of character even though a bit tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We didn't try their restaurant, but it looked as though there were probably better places to eat. We also didn't look at the pool and hot tub, but they had a very nice lighted fishing pier, and places to sit and view the ocean.
reviews.title: Stay Here for a good waterfront view from your room balcony

aka: Lighthouse Inn At Aransas Bay Hotel Rockport
description: The Lighthouse Inn is the perfect choice for a vacation on the Texas coastal bay, with full-service accommodations in the beautiful Aransas Bay. Relax and enjoy a laid back Texas getaway with luxurious guest accommodations and amenities and our friendly staff. Positioned at the entrance of Fulton Harbor with a magnificent view of Aransas Bay, enjoy modern amenities, shoreline access and our excellent location close to local attractions and things to do in the Texas Riviera.
